title: Amazon buys 10 more Falcon 9 launches
summary:
Amazon has purchased an additional 10 Falcon 9 launches from SpaceX as part of its efforts to accelerate deployment of its broadband satellite constellation.
The post Amazon buys 10 more Falcon 9 launches appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Starlink and the unravelling of digital sovereignty
summary:
In January 2026, Iranian authorities shut down landline and mobile telecommunications infrastructure in the country to clamp down on coordinated protests. Starlink terminals, which were discreetly mounted on rooftops, helped Iranian protesters bypass this internet blackout. The role played by Starlink in the recent Iranian protests challenges the notion of digital sovereignty and promotes corporate […]
The post Starlink and the unravelling of digital sovereignty appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Transcelestial to provide satellite laser communication terminals to Gilmour Space
summary:
Transcelestial, a startup developing optical communications technologies, has signed an agreement with Gilmour Space Technologies to incorporate its technology on Gilmour Space spacecraft.

title: Apply now to the ESA Graduate Trainee Programme
summary: The 2026 ESA Graduate Trainee positions are now open! If you’re passionate about engineering, science, IT or business, this is your chance to turn your dreams into reality.

title: First launch of Ariane 6 with four boosters
Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 25 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The Starlink 17-32 mission will be the first Starlink mission in February. Liftoff from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base is scheduled for 7:38 a.m. PST (10:38 a.m. EST / 1538 UTC).

title: Countdown underway for critical moon rocket fueling test Monday
summary: The countdown began Saturday evening and will continue through the start of a simulated launch window opening at 9 p.m. EST Monday. The test started two days late because of predicted arctic weather along Florida's Space Coast.
